gamecabinet

Interface GameState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Game

    public interface GameState
    Represents the API which all games must use.
    Author:
    bsea

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        static java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the official name of the game

      • getDescription

        static java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns:
        a description of the game

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        The 'width' of the game. Units are defined by the game itself (pixels, columns, etc) but zero always starts on the left and moves right
        Returns:
        the number of 'columns' in the game

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        The 'height' of the game. Units are defined by the game itself (pixels,rows, etc) but zero always starts at the top and moves down
        Returns:
        the number of 'rows' in the game

      • getInvalidMove

        Move getInvalidMove()
        The game must return what will be an invalid move
        Returns:
        a filled Move which represents an invalid move

      • copyInstance

        GameState copyInstance()
        Returns:
        a new instance of itself which is a COPY of the original

      • minPlayers

        int minPlayers()
        Returns:
        minimum number of players supported by the game

      • maxPlayers

        int maxPlayers()
        Returns:
        maximum number of players supported by the game

      • addPlayer

        boolean addPlayer(Player p)
        Parameters:
        p - the player to add to the game, if not already added
        Returns:
        false if the player cannot be added (over the maximum or they already exist), true otherwise

      • removePlayer

        boolean removePlayer(Player p)
        Parameters:
        p - the player to remove from the game
        Returns:
        false if the player cannot be removed (under the minimum or they are not in the game), true otherwise

      • removePlayer

        Player removePlayer(int num)
        Parameters:
        num - the player index to remove (starting at zero)
        Returns:
        true if the player exists and is removed, false otherwise (going under the minimum)

      • removeAllPlayers

        boolean removeAllPlayers()
        Removes all players in the game
        Returns:
        false if the players cannot be removed for any reason (usually errors)

      • numPlayers

        int numPlayers()
        Returns:
        number of players in the game

      • getPlayer

        Player getPlayer(int num)
        Gets a player who is already in the game
        Parameters:
        num - the index of the player to get (starts at zero)
        Returns:
        the player at the index

      • getPlayers

        java.util.List<Player> getPlayers()
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of players in the game

      • whoseTurn

        java.util.List<Player> whoseTurn()
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of players whose turn is currently being processed

      • getOwner

        Player getOwner(Move m)
        Parameters:
        m - a location of the 'board'
        Returns:
        the player which 'owns' this space, null if the space is 'unowned'

      • addGameStateListener

        boolean addGameStateListener(GameStateListener g)
        Allows for the ability to listen to changes in the GameState
        Parameters:
        g - the listener to notify
        Returns:
        true if the listeners is not already listening, false otherwise

      • removeGameStateListener

        boolean removeGameStateListener(GameStateListener g)
        Parameters:
        g - the listener to remove
        Returns:
        true if the listener is removed, false otherwise

      • removeAllGameStateListeners

        void removeAllGameStateListeners()
        Removes all listeners from this game

      • getValidMoves

        java.util.List<Move> getValidMoves()
        Returns:
        all valid movements for the current gamestate

      • makeMove

        boolean makeMove(Move from,
                 Move to)
        Make a move in the GameState. This method modifies the current object such that the move is made (if valid) and all rule results (side effects) are taken into account
        Parameters:
        from - the location to move from (ignored in some games)
        to - the location to move to
        Returns:
        true if the move was valid, false otherwise

      • isValidMove

        boolean isValidMove(Move from,
                    Move to)
        Check to see if a move is valid. This method do NOT modify the current object in any way.
        Parameters:
        from - the location to move from (ignored in some games)
        to - the location to move to
        Returns:
        true if the move is valid, false otherwise

      • start

        void start()
        Called when the game starts/resumes

      • stop

        void stop()
        Called when the game stops/pauses

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Called when the game needs to cleanup. This represents a complete disposal of the game.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Called when the game needs to reset. The game gets to pick the next start player.

      • reset

        void reset(Player p)
        Called when the game needs to reset using 'p' as the start player.
        Parameters:
        p - the player who should be the start player

      • isGameOver

        boolean isGameOver()
        Returns:
        true if the game is in a final state, false otherwise

      • numTurn

        int numTurn()
        The 'turn' that the game is one. Units are decided by the game (actual turns, milliseconds, etc).
        Returns:
        the turn that the game is on,

      • maxTurns

        int maxTurns()
        Returns:
        max number of turns that this game supports

      • getScore

        int getScore(Player p)
        The score for a particular player in the game without penalties
        Parameters:
        p - the player to score
        Returns:
        the score without penalties

      • getScore

        int getScore(int playerNum)
        The score for a particular player in the game without penalties
        Parameters:
        playerNum - the index of the player to score (starting at zero)
        Returns:
        the score without penalties

      • getWinners

        java.util.List<Player> getWinners()
        Returns the current winning player(s). The list is empty if no winner can be assigned, and can have more than one if there is a tie, or it's a collaborative game.
        Returns:
        the winning player(s) of the game
